head.title: Miscellany on music, geometry and astronomy

msItem.title: Musical diagrams for the diapason and monochord.
msItem.note: Bifolium (fols. 1-2) added probably at a later time.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: De institutione musica
msItem.decoNote: On f. 3v a full page illumination depicting Boethius sitting on a chair and showing at a book. Many digrams and initials in red, green, blue and yellow colours.
msItem.note: On f. 4r a scribe added a second version of the Greek text (found at the beginning of Boethius' text) with Latin transliteration.

msItem.author: Hucbaldus de Sancto Amando
msItem.title: De musica (Fragment)
msItem.decoNote: Full page illustration depicting Guido and Theodaldus.

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit michrologus id est brevis sermo guidonis peritissimi musici et venerabilis monachi.

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscripts is foliated 1-166 including four slips: 16a, 42a, 76a, 91a; and two folia skipped by the previous folliation 45a, 66a.
supportDesc.collation: Quiremarks on the first recto of some quires: II (12r), III (20r), V (36r), VIIII (70r), X (73r), XII (90r), XIII (92r), XIIII (100r), XXIIII (162r), written in red or later black ink; most of the texts have running titles, naming the author and/or work; the geometrical and astronomical sections have running titles 'Geometria' and 'Astronomia'.

layoutDesc.layout: Written mostly in two columns, around 47 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: The illustrations are discussed in Hermann.
